content.question: A right triangle has base <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> meters and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></math> meters, where <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></math> is constant and <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> changes with respect to time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, measured in seconds. The angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, measured in radians, is defined by <math alttext="tangent theta, equals, the fraction h over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Which of the following best describes the relationship between <math alttext="the derivative of theta, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></math> with respect to time, and <math alttext="the derivative of x, with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rate of change of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with respect to time?
